reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used for one night prior to flight to Canada, it was good,clean staff helpful in particular the porter and waitress in the resturant, meal was reasonably priced, well presented and good quality.
reviews.title: Overnighter

reviews.text: Not sure it would make a longer stay as not close to shops or public transport but good for the basis we used it.
reviews.title: Before and after

reviews.text: This seems to be a well-run Novotel. I stated before and after a recent trip to Washington and I was well served on each occasion. The hotel is about 15 minutes from Heathrow Terminal One by 'Hoppa' bus (£4.50 single or £8.00 return). The reception staff were very good - I was allowed access to my room earlier than I might have been - and the room was comfortable and well cared for. The restaurant staff seem to enjoy their work; the food is just right for a hotel of this kind and the whole experience was very pleasant.
reviews.title: Gets the job done

reviews.text: A pretty unremarkable airport hotel but good value if booked in advance and fine for an overnight stay. Hotel rooms seem to have been recently renovated so in good nick and pretty comfortable.
reviews.title: Marvellous

reviews.text: I stayed here for a single night, after taking a National Express Coach down from the Midlands, and before flying home to the States. I was looking for a convenient location that would allow me to get from the Heathrow Central Bus Station and then to Terminal 4 the next day. I found that, apparently, none of the Heathrow hotels have their own shuttle buses, which was annoying, but instead they rely on a "Hoppa Bus" shuttle service which goes to a number of hotels. This service was reasonable and convenient; if possible purchase a Return ticket for £8, rather than two singles at £4.50 each.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel near London Heathrow.

reviews.text: The hotel itself was large and rather pleasant; an attractive central lobby area is flanked by two towers. Staff was multi-lingual and very helpful. A breakfast buffet was included in the room rate. As is the case with most non-US hotels, internet access was NOT included and was rather pricey. The room was large and comfortable and the bed was very refreshing. The Novotel was perfect for this purpose - a single night, pre-flight stay.
reviews.title: Good basic hotel for business stays

reviews.text: Very basic hotel with almost all facilities required by a business traveller available in the rooms and lobby. Easy approach by a cab from Heathrow or thru hotel hoppa. Limited food options but good natured staff makes up for it. Can have a good drink in lobby bar.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've never stayed at a Novotel until this past August when we were camped here for a night before our Caribbean Princess British Isles adventure.
reviews.title: Disappointing Hotel For The Heathrow Area

reviews.text: The Hotel Hopper shuttle system they have at Heathrow is pretty nice - very easy to locate and very convenient. I can't say I have much to complain about the hotel, other than the exorbitant prices at the hotel's restaurant. That was a bit of a handful - so we opted to find cheaper options around the Heathrow area. Rooms are clean and modern and very comfortable and the front desk reception staff were all very friendly and helpful. If I'm ever in town for an over-nighter in London, I'll definitely have to stay here again.
reviews.title: Very nice stay
OK hotel with overpriced restaurant
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night last week. The hotel itself was decent and the room ok.
What made the stay less appealing was the attitude of the front staff. Nothing to put my finger on but they weren't that helpful.
reviews.title: Good Deal Novotel Heathrow

reviews.text: This hotel is idealy located close to terminals 1,2 & 3. A shuttle bus to Heathrow Central Bus station is available every 20 minutes at peak hours (£4.00 one way). It is also possible to get to the hotel using public transport which is cheaper although the closest bus stop is 10 minutes from the hotel, this can be a bit tricky with heavy bags. The hotel is modernly decorated and clean. Service is efficient and friendly at all levels. The hotel rooms are large, modern and clean and seem to be brand new. The beds are very comfortable. I slept perfectly without hearing any outside noise (aircraft movement, traffic around the hotel). The fitness center is very small and the machines need replacing. The swimming pool on the other hand is bliss and spotlessly clean. WIFI is available but expensive whch is a bit of a shame considering that other Novotels offer this service free of charge. All in all a great experience and I would definitely recommend either for a night stay of for a day room waiting for a connecting flight.
reviews.title: Great hotel for an overnight stay!

reviews.text: Food satisfactory, only complaint - coffee at breakfast was poor as if it had been stewed all night.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an oasis after our long flight from Toronto thru New York to Heathrow Airport. The rooms were very modern, bright, with beautiful mattresses and well appointed bed linens. All the extras provided..coffee, tea, bathrobes and slippers, hair products and rain shower head. Only a 20 min. ride from airport to hotel. Lovely atrium and free internet service for those of us who don't have wireless gadgets.
reviews.title: Don't expect much!

reviews.text: I'm normally a big fan of Novotel as it offers good value for families. As usual a warm welcome and helpful staff. But, the pillows were like rocks, which according to reception were standard across the hotel and no softer alternatives were available. And wi-fi cost an extortionate sum. Kid's room well situated, but lacked toys. Good indoor pool. Excellent food at reasonable prices given that you have no other options.
reviews.title: Average by Novotel standards

reviews.text: I arrived a little after midnight, and was greeted by a really friendly and helpful guy at the reception who checked me in really quickly - which is always cool..
reviews.title: All you need for a quick stop over!

reviews.text: The rooms are a little on the basic side, but really clean and comfortable - and all I need considering I'm only here for about six hours..

aka: Novotel London Heathrow Hotel West Drayton
description: The Novotel London Heathrow is located in the heart of Heathrow Airport, 30 minutes from Central London. This hotel is ideal for guests on a business trip offering high speed internet access and extensive conference facilities. Close to StockleyPark andtourist attractions such as Windsor Castle and Legoland. Enjoy contemporary cuisine in the pleasant surroundings of our Elements restaurant and lounge bar. Relax in our heated indoor swimming pool and gym at no extra charge. Onsite parking.
